questions.text: What is the 'skills gap' in the context of Industry 4.0?
options: A gap in physical strength
A mismatch between the skills workers have and the skills needed for new jobs in smart industries
A geographical gap between factories
A gap in the number of available jobs
questions.correctAnswer: A mismatch between the skills workers have and the skills needed for new jobs in smart industries

questions.text: Which of the following is an ethical consideration in IIoT?
options: The color of the sensors
The potential for job displacement due to automation
The speed of the internet connection
The brand of the computer
questions.correctAnswer: The potential for job displacement due to automation

questions.text: How can data ownership be a challenge in IIoT?
options: Data is always owned by the government
It's always clear who owns the data
Complex ownership questions arise when multiple parties (e.g., equipment manufacturer, factory owner, cloud provider) are involved
Data ownership is not a concern
questions.correctAnswer: Complex ownership questions arise when multiple parties (e.g., equipment manufacturer, factory owner, cloud provider) are involved

questions.text: What is a potential privacy issue with IIoT in the workplace?
options: Employees having too much privacy
Monitoring of employee productivity and movements
The office being too cold
The company providing free snacks
questions.correctAnswer: Monitoring of employee productivity and movements

questions.text: What is the concept of 'lights-out' manufacturing?
options: Manufacturing during the day only
A factory that runs fully automated without human presence on-site
A factory with poor lighting
A factory that produces light bulbs
questions.correctAnswer: A factory that runs fully automated without human presence on-site
